mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Margaret Sweat to James Hollingsworth, 1878 May 19
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sweat, Margaret J. M. (Margaret Jane Mussey), 1823-1908
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Margaret Sweat, Vice Regent for Maine, to James Hollingsworth, superintendent, May 19 1878. Milwaukee. Had long interview with Mrs. Barry in Chicago. Refers to Mrs. Halsted's plan for Hall floor and arch in Hall. Wants a competent person to handle affair and give estimates, suggestions re a wooden carpet, a solid oak floor, costs, durability of same, etc. She is now with Mrs. Mitchell.
